config.title: Blood pressure quiz
config.intro_copy:
Around 30% of people in England have high blood pressure but many don't know it. If left untreated, high blood pressure increases your risk of a heart attack or stroke.
It's important to know what affects our blood pressure and what you can do to keep your blood pressure at a healthy level.
Take this short quiz and see how much you know.
config.intro_copy_alt:
High blood pressure is often called the 'silent killer' because so many people don't know they have it. If left untreated, high blood pressure increases your risk of a heart attack or stroke.

It's important to know what affects our blood pressure and what you can do to keep your blood pressure at a healthy level.

Take this short quiz and see how much you know.

q.title: New question
q.quiz_summary: More than 1 in 4 (a quarter) of people in England have high blood pressure.
q.quiz_check: More than 1 in 4 (a quarter) of people in England have high blood pressure (hypertension) - it is one of the biggest causes of premature death and disability.

q.title: New question
q.body:
Do you think the following statement is true or false?
'If you don’t have any symptoms you don’t need a blood pressure test'
q.quiz_summary: High blood pressure doesn't usually cause symptoms and the only way to know your blood pressure is to get tested.
q.quiz_check:
High blood pressure doesn't usually cause symptoms and the only way to know your blood pressure is to get tested.

This is why it is often known as the ‘silent killer'.

q.title: New question
q.body:
Do you think the following statement is true or false?
'If high blood pressure runs in your family there is nothing you can do to stop developing high blood pressure yourself'
q.quiz_summary: If high blood pressure runs in your family you're more likely to develop it.
q.quiz_check: If high blood pressure runs in your family you're more likely to develop it, but you can still reduce your risk by maintaining a healthy weight and eating a balanced diet.

q.title: New question
q.body: If you have high blood pressure you will need to take medication for life
q.quiz_summary: A diagnosis of high blood pressure does not necessarily mean that you will need to begin taking medication.
q.quiz_check: A diagnosis of high blood pressure does not necessarily mean that you will need to begin taking medication. Simple lifestyle changes, such as having a healthier diet or being more active, can significantly lower your blood pressure without medication.

q.title: New question
q.body: I don’t add extra salt to my food so my blood pressure can’t be high
q.quiz_summary: Although cutting down on salt will reduce blood pressure, it is not the only cause.
q.quiz_check: About 75% of the salt we consume is hidden in processed foods such as bread, breakfast cereal and ready meals. Although cutting down on salt will reduce blood pressure, it is not the only cause.

q.title: New question
q.body: Do you think the following statement is true or false? 'If a man is obese he is 4 times more likely to develop high blood pressure'
q.quiz_summary: Obesity multiplies the risk of developing high blood pressure about fourfold in men and almost threefold in women.
q.quiz_check: Obesity affects around a quarter of adults in England. Obesity multiplies the risk of developing high blood pressure about fourfold in men and almost threefold in women.

q.title: New question
q.body: Do you think the following statement is true or false? 'I had my blood pressure checked around 5 years ago so I know my blood pressure is low'
q.quiz_summary: Your blood pressure can fluctuate, which is why all adults should get tested at least every 5 years.
q.quiz_check: Your blood pressure can fluctuate, which is why all adults should get tested at least every 5 years. Those more at risk - such as people of African or Caribbean descent, older people or people who are overweight or obese - should be checked more regularly.

q.title: New question
q.body: Do you think the following statement is true or false? 'You need to make an appointment and see your GP to get a blood pressure test'
q.quiz_summary: You don't have to see your GP to get a blood pressure test. Nurses or healthcare assistants can test you.
q.quiz_check: You don't have to see your GP to get a blood pressure test. Nurses or healthcare assistants can test you, some surgeries have self-service machines, many pharmacies offer free tests and you can even buy cheap, accurate monitors to use at home. If you are between the ages of 40 and 74, you could get your blood pressure tested through the free NHS Health Check programme.

q.title: New question
q.body: What conditions can high blood pressure lead to? You can pick more than one:
q.quiz_summary: High blood pressure is a risk factor for heart attack, stroke, kidney disease and dementia.
q.quiz_check: High blood pressure is a risk factor for heart attack, stroke, kidney disease and dementia.

q.title: New question
q.body: What factors are known to increase the risk of developing high blood pressure? You can pick more than one.
q.quiz_summary: Being overweight, too much salt in your diet, not being active enough, drinking too much alcohol, stress and family history are all risk factors.
q.quiz_check: Being overweight, too much salt in your diet, not being active enough, drinking too much alcohol, stress and family history are all risk factors.

a.body: Too much salt in your diet
Family history of high blood pressure

results.ri: Oh dear. You don't know very much about blood pressure. The more you know, the better you can protect your health.
Well done, you know quite a bit about blood pressure. The more you know, the better you can protect your health.
Brilliant! You really know your stuff when it comes to blood pressure. The more you know, the better you can protect your health.
Below is an overview of the blood pressure facts:

links.li: With high blood pressure affecting over a quarter of all adults in England it is important that everyone takes the time to get checked and to take action to lower their risk. Here are some links that you might find useful:

link_items.ri: Get your free NHS Health Check
Healthy living for your family - Change4Life
